meanings.definition: A large, flightless bird of the pigeon family, now extinct.
meanings.sent1: The dodo was a big bird that couldn't fly.
meanings.sent2: People used to see dodos on an island long ago.
meanings.sent3: The dodo tried to fly by jumping off a cliff, but it didn't work out well.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the dodo symbolized the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The dodo's extinction serves as a reminder of the impact of humans on nature.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a dodo and forget your keys at home.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a dodo when he realized he went to the wrong class.
meanings.sent3: The dodo in the group always made everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dodo in the meeting when she couldn't answer any questions.
meanings.sent5: Being a dodo in this situation means you need to pay more attention.
